instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, No green Light, no power on after short while testing <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Have a liquid damaged <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, Replaced the battery and it would boot from the battery. 27% charged when charger was connected it read 100% and charging with no light on the mag-safe. I was trying to test <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and my shaky hands bridged two  SMDs with my positive lead from my multi-meter. <CAPACITOR>C7102</CAPACITOR> connected to  <CAPACITOR>C7116</CAPACITOR>. Now I got no power on from battery, and it no longer powers on when I connect the charger. Did I just kill this board? Is <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> now dead, SMC or is this still fixable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, No green Light, no power on after short while testing <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Yes you have put 12V on the 3V42 line. Probably a dead SMC and everything else on the 3V42 rail. Fixable but this is pretty fried.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, No green Light, no power on after short while testing <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Crap. It was just a split second, what would go out first? <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> or maybe <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, No green Light, no power on after short while testing <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Everything goes in a split second. I think there are about 10 components on this rail that are fried. I have fixed boards like this before but it is a lot of work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, No green Light, no power on after short while testing <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I didn't have a battery connected, just a magsafe. It wasn't on at the time, is that 12v always present there? Or could I have done damage in another way here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, No green Light, no power on after short while testing <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: You can keep on thinking up stuff but this board got fried. Resistance to GND on PP3V42 is probably shorted or low. SMC is surely dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, No green Light, no power on after short while testing <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Oh well. No real loss, I got it for free because it was water damage to begin with. Guess my shaky hards can't do this work anymore. Thanks for the input.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, No green Light, no power on after short while testing <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Fixable board! Sell it to me!
